comments.comment_title: Fraud not addressed after a month!
comments.comment_content: Fraud not addressed after a month of fraudulent charges!! My 2 kids have had an account with this company for over a year and everything was ok until one day I got a text alert notifying me that my son's account was $-400+!! I immediately called and wanted it straightened out. I was told that they just found out about this "glitch" and were "working hard to fix it". There was no block put on the card and over the next week we watched money be credited back and then charged again and again.I called them a week later to find out what was going on. I was told I would be put on a "watch list" and when the account was straightened out I would be notified. I asked for my account to be closed and was told that was impossible until it was straightened out. Frustrated I agreed. I noticed they STILL did not block funds on his card so I personally put a block on it to try to salvage SOME of his money. Why on Earth they didn't do this to begin with as any normal institution would I have no idea!! 2 weeks later I'm still seeing charges be attempted to my son's account but as I blocked it they are not gong through (thankfully). I called them this morning to demand my account be credited back and closed. Once again I got the "I apologize for your inconvenience" garbage (but the CSR was very kind btw), and there is nothing they can do until it's been straightened out! I was able to cancel my daughter's card and have that credited back to my bank account...... we'll see if that happens.... but my son's is still in limbo.Upon speaking to my bank on the matter they referred me to the fraud department of the FDIC of which I am going to file a claim. As it is under $500 I'm not expecting much but maybe it will flag this company.If you want to use this system to pay your kids, talk to your bank!! Ours can set it up to be just like GoHenry's system AND pay interest w/o fees. That is the route we should have gone in the first place.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Kate, thank you for taking the time to leave your review. We are so sorry to hear that this has been your experience with us. I have just tried to call you and discuss this further, however it appears I chose a poor moment, so I followed up with an email to you instead. Please do reach back out when you get the chance, if you so wish, and we will be happy to discuss this further.~Sally

comments.comment_content: Doesn't accept provisional driving licenses despite there not being any reason to. A full license is no more proof of ID than a provisional, the ONLY difference is that one can drive with it. A company that you can't sign up to until you've passed your driving test when it has nothing to do with driving is ridiculous!
comments.company_response_content: Hi there Socially Awkward Memes,Thank you for your review.I have checked with our team regarding the reason we are unable to accept provisional licences, This is a standard banking procedure and most high street banks do not accept this form of identification to open an account. The reason we have been given is that a full licence has additional checks such as attending a test centre and being present at the time of the test to verify your identity and obtaining a provisional license does not have this check in place. Our issuing bank has also confirmed that we cannot accept provisional licences to open the account.As a financial service, we are required to 'know' our customers. We carry out a widely-used check called a Know Your Customer check (KYC) to comply with our regulatory obligations. We do this check at the time of sign-up, by matching your details against a number of public record databases such as; the electoral roll, the telephone landline database and Experian. This identity check is not a credit check and does not affect your credit score in anyway, although it will show as a trace on your credit history.If you are not registered on these databases, for example you are only on the private electoral roll and not the public record, or your phone number is ex-directory, we will not be able to match your details online. Should this happen, we'll ask you to contact us with additional information to confirm your identity.I am unable to see an account attempted for you as you have not provided TP with your email address to contact you to discuss your concerns. If you would like to know what forms of ID we can accept, Please can I ask that you email us at help@gohenrycard.com with the subject heading FAO Supervisors and we will be able to assist you further.Thanks - Kay

I am only glad that we were defrauded of $33 and I didn't have more loaded, or else that's what they would be looking for me to reload...JUST TO CANCEL THE ACCOUNT!! comments.comment_title: The price is what I do not like
comments.comment_content: The price is what I do not like.   My transaction fees are not as steep as my child account.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Lisha, thank you for your feedback. The charges passed on to parents for gohenry membership are to simply keep the service running. We believe the unique features of our website, apps, and cards provide families with flexibility and convenience to manage money together and to help their children learn valuable money skills that will help them through life. For us, this makes the $4.99 monthly subscription charge great value for money.Here are some of the reasons we believe gohenry offers great value for money: Parental controls: our service offers children independence whilst the underlying control still sits with the parent to allow them to guide by setting spending limits and selecting where the card can be used.Mobile notifications: both parents and children can receive real-time notifications of any spending, available balances, and reasons for declined transactions - keeping you both informed every step of the way.Online and mobile access: gohenry provides online and mobile banking.Free loads to the parent account: Add money to your parent account with no extra charges as well as free unlimited transfers between the parent and child account.Contactless cards: our cards enables your children to enjoy contactless payments.Tasks and chores: the ability to set up tasks and chores for your children to earn extra money.Savings goals: because it's not all about spending, goals to save for that special something can be set up to help motivate whilst educating!Giftlinks: friends and family can gift money to the child for special occasions like birthdays and holidays, or send a one-off gift for anything elseSupport 7 days a week: We are open 9am to 5pm EST, 7 days a week, and ready to help.We hope this gives you a better insight into the membership subscription charges.- Suvechha 😊

comments.comment_title: My husband chose the Gohenry for our…
comments.comment_content: My husband chose the Gohenry for our three children 4 years ago. It was great, but the only problem was, the amount of fees that accumulated over time. There was 4.99 monthly per account maintenance fee and then ATM fees! I have teens, so of course they would want to withdraw money when out with their friends!I was unaware of the amount of fees because I trusted that my husband carefully did his due diligence. After noticing all the fees on their accounts from using ATM machines, I was upset.I looked for other options earlier this year and realized that JPMORGAN Chase teamed up with Greenlight and no monthly fees! They can use their card and withdraw money wherever there's a Chase ATM! That was the better option. My time is too valuable to login, add money to the parent account, then distribute it from there! When we closed the accounts, the kids had to drain their funds because we couldn't transfer them back to our bank accounts. Good luck to the parents that chose Gohenry and all the fees that comes with it!
comments.company_response_content: Hi Jojo, thank you for your feedback. As we are charged fees for any ATM withdrawal, therefore, to absorb the cost, this is passed to the members. When the accounts are canceled, funds remaining in the account would have been refunded back to the card on file. We understand GoHenry may not be the best option for all families but we're glad to see you've found something that fits you and your family's needs. -Suvechha 😊

comments.comment_content: I was excited to use gohenry based on their privacy stance for children and edu materials, so much so that I was willing to pay a nice premium over the free accounts my bank offers for kids 6+.  The actual experience is a nightmare however, the tech integration with Plaid is broken, their support teams are unresponsive, their online chat ghosted me every time, and their email support never responded.  I understand that technology is unreliable at times but when the people supporting it are also unreliable, that's a huge red flag to steer clear.  This company has a great idea, unfortunately, it could not be more poorly operated.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Bill, I am sorry to hear that you were having issues with the PLAID interaction to your account. I have managed to locate your account and I will try and give you a call to discuss the issue and also the issues that you have faced with our Live Chat process. If I don't get to speak to you, I will follow up with an email. If you could reply to the email and it will be returned to the Supervisor Queue or give us a call on (877)372 6466 (9am-5pm EST) - Thanks and I look forward to hearing from you. Thanks Kay

comments.comment_content: Extortionate Fees & Clueless SupportTrying to help your kids save when you are charged an extortionate monthly fee.They charge you for everything, adding funds to the parent account expect to pay a 10% feeSending funds from the Parent account to the child account that's another 10% fee.I have had an account with them for 1 year and I've had enough, account is closed, and looking for a different company.I forgot to mention that customer service is an absolute joke, they have no clue what's going on.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Ima TradingThank you for taking the time to leave us a review, I am so sorry that you did not experience GoHenry the way we hoped you would.I understand that it has been a frustrating experience I have tried to look into this for you, but unfortunately, with no email address to look into or your full name hasn't been attached to the review, I could not find your account to truly understand the context of your experience.Here at GoHenry we strive to provide the best service and product we can for each and every one of our members we know we don't always get it right but always work hard to remediate the situation.In regards to loading funds onto your parent account, there is no 10% fee to do this and all the funds you load will go on to the parent account and to quick transfer from the parent account to the child account there is no charge for this and goes over instantly.If you could please get in touch with us via call on (877)3726466 we're open 7 days a week 9-17:00 EST or email us at help@gohenrycard.com and title the subject FAO Supervisors and we can look into this urgently and assist you with this matter. Many thanks for taking the time to leave us your review and we hope to get this resolved for you as soon as possible! - George

I lost confidence in the company.

comments.comment_title: Terrible customer service if you have a problem
comments.comment_content: I have had very few problems with the card other than its ability to work with vending machines and is not venmo compatible.   However if your child ever loses their card that is where the lack of customer service begins.  My daughter lost her card and we immediately reported it lost and they said we will send you a new one.  I get an email saying your card is on the way and should be there in 7-10 days.  1st red flag. No tracking number and was being delivered snail mail via USPS. My daughter is away at school and needed the card.  After 15 days i called and they ssid wait another 5 days.  I did.  Then i called again and they said sorrry would you like to reorder and i said sure.  I said can you overbight it and put a tracking number on it.  They said NO.  I said can I speak to someone who can authorize this and said no one can.  So now they want me to wait another 10-15 days and see whether I receive a replacement card.  This is not the kind of customer service I expect from financial i would suggest you not do business with this company.   BTW i asked for the CEO email address and she assured me she would send it to me and she didn’t.

comments.comment_content: In order to review this company, I am simply going to summarize my experience with it. I got this card for my 7 year old son for his birthday. I have deposited all his piggybank savings in it and he even got some money sent in the account from relatives for his birthday. I gave the card to him on his birthday. He had approximately $600 in his account and I put in around $200 in my parent account in order to pay him for chores and allowances.2 weeks later on September 30th, his account was hacked. My parental controls were changed. His pin, his spending limits, etc were all maxed out on the app. The approximately $200 in my parent account was fully transferred to his child account. Then there were two charges made on fraudulent Chinese websites that basically drained his account to near zero. After being on hold for 2 HOURS AND 30 MINS to talk to someone at your customer service that day, it took me 5-6 days to get my son's STOLEN money refunded by GoHenry and 10 days to get receive his newly issued physical card in the mail. But they refunded the entire money back to my son’s account, not to the parent account. I went to the website and the FAQ  section clearly states the easiest way is to withdraw from an ATM. That's what I did. By the way, each withdrawal limit is only $100 per day. And it costs me $1.50 fee from GoHenry and $3 fee from the bank's ATM. Then after all this, instead of apologizing for all the inconveniences that was caused to me and my 7 year old, the company freezes my account without talking to me, because I withdrew money from the ATM multiple days in a row. To be frank, I do not even care, because GoHenry is unsafe for my son's funds. After 11 days, I am still waiting to receive hundreds of dollars to be refunded back to my REAL bank account. Use a real bank, not this app....
comments.company_response_content: Hi ThereThank you for taking the time to leave us a review, I am so sorry that you did not experience GoHenry the way we hoped you would.I understand that it has been a frustrating experience I have tried to look into this for you, but unfortunately, with no email address to look into or your name hasn't been attached to the review, I could not find an account.From your review I can understand the money being refunded to the child as this did come from the child's card originally but I would need to see the account to have a further look and discuss with the relevant department in why the account was blocked.We are really keen to help you get this resolved and looked into straight away as a matter of urgency so please do send us an email with the subject - FAO supervisors from your regsistered email address and we will pick this up or call us on (877)3726466 were open 9-17:00 EST 7 days a week. - George

comments.comment_title: So far I've had nothing but issues…
comments.comment_content: So far I've had nothing but issues with GoHenry. I needed to update our address in order to link my debit card which reflects my new address, GoHenry required the address match my state issued driver's license which I hadn't updated yet. I told customer service I had planned on getting an updated one but that in Alaska it can take a month to get the new one in the mail so I asked if my temp would be valid, I was told yes. So I got my temporary card, called in again to update the address and was then told they in fact do not accept temporary ID's and I would have to wait for the permanent one to come in. Meanwhile my kids allowance is continuing to accumulate and so I was told I could use the gift link if I wanted to send them funds until my official DL comes in to change the billing address. I used the links and paid both my kids...who by the way are far more persistent and pressing than ANY debt collector could be. So allowances are paid...or so I thought. Apparently the funds I sent are only seen as "gifts" and now the app still shows I owe them allowance money (plus the extras for odd tasks and the educational quizzes they'd done). I've searched and searched but I don't see a way to remove the allowance that the app says they're still owed which is now making it appear there's a debt when I've actually paid them and now I'll have to essentially double pay in order to get back on schedule but who knows how long or how much that will be since I'm still waiting for my ID to come in. I can cancel the allowance...and the tasks...and the learning bonus...but then that doesn't let my kids actually see what they've earned which is one of the main aspects of them learning about finances. I'm just thinking I may have made the wrong call choosing GoHenry and at this point am actively looking for alternative services that may work better for us.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Alyssa, Thank you for taking the time to leave us a feedback. I had taken a look into your account with the email provided and I can see that you have gotten in touch with us today and given your details to have the address updated in the account, which has been escalated, and a secure link will be sent within 24 hours. Under the U.S Patriot Act, we are required that we 'know our customer' and we use an online idenitfication and address verfication service to comply- therefore we can only accept either state ID or full driver's license. While looking into the account, I can see that there has been successful loads made into the account, today and 10-14-2022. The attempts before this had been declined due to the billing address mismatch. As for the allowance, until you are able to load funds into the account, you have the option to change the allowance to '$0.00' and add money manually - to do this and top the account up when and needs be: 1. Login to your GoHenry account on the app 2. Tap ‘Money’ at the bottom of the page 3. Tap on the relevant child shown at the top of your screen4. Tap the ‘Allowance’ option 5. Tap ‘Weekly Allowance’ 6. Change the child’s allowance amount to $0 7. Tap ‘Save’ It is disappointing to hear that you are not fully satisfied with our app. We review all feedback received to ensure we learn from the times when we don’t quite get it right. If we could offer our further assistance then, please do let us know by either emailing us at help@gohenrycard.com, alternatively you can join us at LiveChat or call us at 877 372 6466. -Suvechha

comments.comment_title: My kids love their own debit card!
comments.comment_content: We’ve been using this app for about a month. My kids have done so well with this concept. They ask for extra chores so they see their balance on their GoHenry Account go up. I’ve been looking for something like this to help my kids learn about money. I’ve spoiled them a little and they have come to expect things when they really have done nothing to deserve it.  So far it’s worked really well in teaching them how to save money and to understand that Mom isn’t made of money. The app is so simple. I just add funds from my debit card onto GoHenry and I can add any amount to my kids accounts anytime and it posts immediately into their accounts. I can even block funds if they’ve had a bad behavior day. I would recommend this for parents. My kids are 13 and 9. It seems the perfect age for this app.  I’m going to use this app long until my kids are adults. Thank you GoHenry!

comments.comment_content: It’s a wonderful app and parenting tool/learning tool for kids and adolescents. My primary complaints are that it’s difficult to re-draw (return to your bank account) the money you hold in your gohenry parent account, and certain businesses that sell alcohol (some restaurants/etc) sometimes fail to process transactions because gohenry deems them “adult businesses”. I appreciate the safety aspects of that feature for kids, but it can be a hassle for my teen.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Shelle, thank you very much for your review! In regards to the over 18s merchants, they have to legally classify themselves as over 18s due to selling cigarettes or alcohol on the premises and as the GoHenry card has a teen chip implemented by Visa, it automatically blocks these transactions. However, this usually only applies to small corner shops or newsagents and we recommend the child withdraws some cash from a nearby ATM if necessary. We appreciate this can be frustrating and apologise for any inconveniences this may cause. - Eisha 😊

comments.comment_content: UPDATE: As expected, the company replied to my negative review almost immediately. At the same time, I had to wait on hold for an hour to get someone at customer service on the phone. That person and their supervisor attempted to blame my daughter and the vendor for not scanning the card properly. They attempted multiple times and multiple methods and couldn't get it to work. The vendor had no difficulty scanning anyone else's card though (not a GoHenry cards, obviously...there is a reason nobody else has heard of them or used them). They wouldn't even address me telling them that I couldn't transfer money from my bank or to my daughter's card during the same time (there was apparently something wrong with their processing system but they refuse to admit it). I explained I had tried at least 20 times and it kept crashing. They couldn't see it on their side so they wouldn't address and implied that I did something wrong. Go read reviews in the app store, this site, BBB, or any where else they are reviewed. You will see similar reviews. This company is awful. Their service is terrible and their customer service is even worse. RUN! (END OF UPDATE) ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW:Awful awful experience. This is the worst, most unreliable debit card you could dream of. Dropped my daughter off somewhere last night, she ordered food where she was, it came, she tried to pay and couldn't. She called me, I went to the app and she had more than she needed, but I still thought I should try to add more...that wouldn't work either. So the app and card were not working and would not do the one thing they were supposed to do...make payments. I tried to call or chat, but their customer service is 9-5pm only. Even if it was open it wouldn't have mattered because I am on hold while typing this and have been for 35 minutes and only gone from 12 to 5 in the queue so I would have had to pick her up before I got someone on the phone. Beyond that every 10 seconds or so their hold recording comes on to try to get me to use the chat, email or FAQ so they don't have to answer my call.This is not the first issue I have had with them. I have had a problem where my daughter couldn't pay her sit down restaurant meal (you know...when they bring you a check after you have already had your meal and incurred the cost) because they consider that an "alcohol establishment" and don't allow them to use the card. So it is really comforting knowing that they are protecting my child by putting her a potentially dangerous situation when she can't pay for the food she ate. I didn't ask her not to be able to pay at "alcohol establishments" but what I, as her parent, want is superseded by what GoHenry thinks would be best for my child. What you have here is a broken system where the debit card and app are unreliable (I have never actually heard of a debit card or credit card just not working in the first place) and the customer service is awful. They need to choose either bad products or bad customer service but they can't have both.
comments.company_response_content: UPDATE - I am so sorry that your experience on this day was not the service that we always strive to deliver to all of our members and I want to thank you so much for taking my call last night.  Talking to you enabled me to discover what had caused this issue and gave me some area's that I have followed up on too, but it also enabled me to show you some areas from the app that will certainly help you identify why a txn has declined in the future.  I hope that our conversation was helpful and that your daughter enjoys her "lunch on us" as an apology for any distress caused.   Leslie      Hi AS - I am so very sorry to read of your recent experience your daughter had using her card to pay for her meal, we would never want one of our children to be in this position, so I would really like the opportunity to look into this further for you to see what the reason for this was, but I am not able to see your email address in your TP review to enable me to locate your account - In order for me to find your account, would you please send us an email to help@gohenrycard.com and in the subject please put - for the attention of Leslie - I can then trace this quickly and act on this asap for you.It is possible that it was due to the Merchant setting themselves up with over 18's merchant code on their card reader, as you had experienced once before -  due to our cards having a Teen chip, any retailer that has set themselves up as an over 18's merchant, the card would decline.  The Teen chip works really well to protect our kids and to give our parents peace of mind that the wrong purchases are not able to be made by a child, however we do recognise that in some circumstances, it would be helpful for our parent to be able to  to override this, and so we are currently working on developing this option from within the app.I look forward to receiving your email very soon, so that I can look at what happened and help you and your daughter to avoid this situation going forward.  Leslie

comments.comment_content: A rip off. They take more money than a regular bank and most of what the child earns. Service is terrible.
comments.company_response_content: Hi there, I am sorry to hear you feel this way. We just wanted to give somefurther information in regards to our fees and why we have these to give some clarity so I hope this helps.The charges passed on to parents for GoHenry membership is to simply keep the service running.  We believe the unique features of our website, apps and card provides families with flexibility and convenience to manage money together and to help their children learn valuable money skills that will help them through life. For us, this makes the £2.99 monthly subscription charge great value for money.Where there are fees that fall outside your monthly membership subscription, it’s because we are charged by our banking partners for the service they provide to authorise and process our payments. Due to regulations (PSD2), we needed to make some changes to ensure that all our members were being treated equally when topping up their accounts. We provide our customers with one load per calendar month which is included in their subscription. To avoid any service charges, we advise that customers load their parent account once a month with all the weekly allowance, task money, and monthly fee needed for that month. However, where we can we have covered certain banking charges and we work to keep any charges to a bare minimum.It is always disappointing to lose a member but we genuinely need to make the charges we do in order to be able to offer the service we do and to ensure we are able to deliver the best in digital money management to our members.We would like to take this opportunity to thank you for your membership. If you have any further queries, our Member Services team are available 7 days a week from 8am to 8pm on 0330 100 7676 or at help@gohenry.co.uk. - Ellie :)

comments.comment_content: Trash .... the card declined all the time although there was money on it. Go Henry is entirely too complicated!
comments.company_response_content: Hi Tremell, I am so sorry to hear that your first transaction declined.Most restaurants and beauty salon's tend to charge 20% tips. Its totally up to you as the customer whether you pay tips or not, but in some cases tips are deducted. Often times these tips are authorised and processed alongside the transaction, sometimes tips are compulsory and taken in the same way.This uncertintity can cause some issues when processing the payment. To combat this GoHenry adds 20% to the transaction temporarily, to ensure that if tips are claimed they are accounted for as part of the payment. If they are not claimed the extra 20% falls back into your account when the transaction finalises. Sadly if the extra 20% isnt in the account the transaction will fail.  We would advise members to just ensure the cards are loaded with the expected amount plus 20% should the child shop or eat at a beauty salon or restruraunt. I hope this helps- Elaine

It also offers games that educate toward financial responsibility and aids with the idea that earning requires effort. I highly recommend the app.
comments.company_response_content: Hi there, thank you for this amazing review, lovely to hear you and your family are enjoying GoHenry 😄 - Millie

comments.comment_title: Extremely secure for parents and super helpful for kids
comments.comment_content: Go Henry has been great for both me and my kids. They absolutely love doing the money missions and they’ve learned a lot from them. One of my kids has ADHD and go Henry has helped him stay on task with his chores and create healthy spending habits where he can see what he earns, how he spends it and what he’s saving. When I had my wallet stolen from me which had their cards in it, I was instantly able to lock their cards with just a quick click and Go Henry had new cards issued to them within a matter of 2 days! The customer service was very nice and helpful in a stressful situation. I highly recommend Go Henry to anyone!
comments.company_response_content: Hi Rachel 👋 Thank you for your 5🌟 review! Wow, we're very grateful for your review on the money missions, customer service and further features🤗! We're very glad to hear your kids are enjoying GoHenry and happy they're continuing to gain early money management skills. - Zaria 😊

comments.comment_title: My daughter is enjoying having access…
comments.comment_content: My daughter is enjoying having access to her own money and being able to choose how to save, spend and contribute it. The money missions to teach kids about how money works are useful and my child is working through them. I hope that more missions will continue to be added as they were one of the reasons that I chose GoHenry. The savings goals and tasks to earn money are great. We could use a few more icons to represent our goals and tasks and be able to customize them. While I like that GoHenry includes an option for m daughter to give to the Boys' and Girls' Club, the limitation on the amount and the fact that there is only one charity to choose from are frustrations for us. My daughter initially suggested $5 per week and was very disappointed to learn she could only give 25 cents per week through GoHenry. While she willing contributes to other causes independent of GoHenry, we do hope that GoHenry will expand the options for charitable giving to include more charities and at much greater amounts. All in all, the app is pretty easy to use and we like the flexibility of moving the money were we need it on the spot. I have recommended the app to friends and will continue to.
comments.company_response_content: Hi there! Thank you for leaving this lovely review and feedback. We are glad to hear that you and your daughter are enjoying the service, and we will carry the feedback forward.- Aliyah 🙂

comments.comment_title: Can be declined at places such as Mexican restaurants
comments.comment_content: It’s very user-friendly, but my son couldn’t use it at a Mexican restaurant because it was tagged as selling adult beverages there.  It was quite embarrassing for him because the restaurant just saw that it was declined. From what I can find, there is no way to change those settings.  His friend’s parent had to pay for his meal.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Kay, as a financial service for kids, the cards will not work at any retailer registered as an 18+ business as GoHenry is for children aged 6-18 years old. We apologise for any inconveniences this may cause. If you have any further queries, please contact us on 0330 100 7676 / (877) 372-6466 and we will be more than happy to help. - Kate

comments.comment_title: US users can't assign their own PIN
comments.comment_content: Went through all the rules and regulations.  Ordered the card and deposited the money. Got the card for a man with memory issues so I ensured that the pin could be changed to one he can remember.  Got the card, and on the app you can't change the pin. It told me to go to an atm that has that option.  So I used the search parameters on the link go henry provided. Drove 30 miles to that specific atm go henry said would do that function,  to find it would not work. Called go henry and was told it's not possible to change thr pin if you live in the US. So it's been a huge waste of time and money.

comments.comment_title: If i could do zero stars that would be…

Mind you, i have a newborn at home so doing all of this is newrly impossible for me at the moment anyways. So we send an email. Says it can take 3 days for them to reply?!!! So then we go to the chat, we are somehow sent to the UK and needed to be transferred to the US. BOT SAYS ITS TRANSFERRING BUT IT NEVER HAPPENS! Well it's been almost 4 days now. It's 2022, I should be able to simply unlock my son's account from the app! And now waiting to get the money back that's on the card! Stay far away! Customer service is nonexistent.  Absolutely terrible. I am very, very angry about this.

comments.comment_title: It’s OK for traditional families, but not modern ones.
comments.comment_content: I mean, it’s generally a good tool, but a bit expensive for it to not be setup for modern families, where there are multiple parents who can oversee kiddos. They have multiple households, but not multiple parents🙄 So it’s not the best, but it does the job. If you can hack the system, you can make it work but it’s not entirely intuitive.Update to the response below: our kiddo has four parents across two houses (stepparents). The option below only allows for two parents total to assign tasks and check them off. So that means only one parent in each house can actually access the account. And no, stepparents aren't "relatives." We're parents, and we help guide the growth of our kiddos, too.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Lauren, thank you for your feedback! We do have our co-parent feature, were multiple parents can overlook the account. To be able to add a co-parent, all you would need to do is follow the steps below:- Log into the parent account via the mobile app- Click on 'Add a co-parent' which is in the left menu of the mobile app. - Share the link via SMS, Email or any other method supported by iOS or Android. The invite will be valid for only 14 days. - The co-parent can click on the invite link, and they will be asked to download the mobile app. - When the co-parent opens the app, they will be guided through a registration process. Here they will be asked to enter their email address, and their personal information. - After completing the registration, co-parents will be automatically linked to the family account. They will be able to log in using their own email and password. Hope this explains how to add a co-parent, however if you have any further questions, do not hesitate to contact us again! - Nuria

comments.comment_title: The app is fine but from the parent end…
comments.comment_content: The app is fine but from the parent end it’s difficult to move money around and to set up spend limits. The constant offers to purchase cards with new designs is VERY annoying when you are trying to get your kid not to spend money on useless things yet they are given the ability to purchase cards with new designs on their own.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Cary, Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review, I'm so sorry that you have not experienced our service the way we hoped you would. If you need to update any sort of limits or move any money around the account, you are able to do this via the app in a few simple steps. if you click on money at the bottom of the screen of your device and click on your child's name that you would change the limits on, you will then see a little circle that will say limits underneath, if you then click on edit it will allow you too change the limits for, weekly spend limit, single spend limit and the limit for the use of an ATM. If you then click save it will save it all for it and will be updated there and then.If you are looking to move funds from the parent balance over to the child, under parent balance it will say quick transfer this will then allow you to move the funds to your son/daughter.We do provide a wide range of Custom cards, which is a one off payment of $4.99, we provide these custom cards so this way the children can pick a card that suits them best! If the card is ever lost or damaged we will go ahead and replace that card for you free of charge.If you need any further assistance with this please do get in contact with us via email on help@gohenrycard.com or give us a call on 8773726466- we are open 9-5 EST.-Hannah

comments.comment_title: Teaching your kids about financial literacy is critical
comments.comment_content: This app really helps me in my efforts to teach my daughters about financial literacy. They’ve learned how to be responsible, how take into account how much money they have available to spend before they spend. For instance, my oldest had to learn the hard way one time. She went to pay for her items at Walmart only to witness her card being declined. Sadly she was quite embarrassed. I had to reiterate to her the importance of knowing her financial standpoint prior to making a purchase. I explained that it’s better to experience this as a child than when she grows up. Needless to say she never made that mistake again. Moreover, with the spending limit settings it aids me in teaching them about spending in moderation and making a decision about what items are right now items. Sometimes we have a belief that everything is a right now need just because we have the money. Nevertheless that is not the case. The saving feature is really great as well. Although I had to lock the savings because they would move money from the saving just because they wanted a particular item. I’ve been guilty of that as well, because growing up I didn’t have anyone to teach me about finances, aside from being cheap. Being cheap doesn’t mean you are financially literate. When you have goals intended for your savings you have to ensure that your not just freely taking money out of your savings merely because you WANT something vs you urgently need something.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Felishia, Thank you for leaving us a review today, we really do appreciate you lovely feedback.We are so so happy to hear that are cards are working for your daughter's, we aim to teach children how to save and how to spend there money and this has worked for you, we also do provide a service on the app where the children can interact and learn more about saving and how to spend there money, this is provided on the app for all children-money missions!-Hannah

comments.comment_title: My problem with GoHenry is the lack of…
comments.comment_content: My problem with GoHenry is the lack of communication.  About 2 months ago I ordered a new card for my son.  When we received the card I was having a hard time activating it.  When I finally called I was informed that they were having trouble activating cards and I would receive an email when the problem was rectified.  To my knowledge I didn’t receive any communication that the problem was rectified and therefore went with another card company.  I called and closed the account on June 10th.  I was told by the representative at that time that my request was processed and I should receive my money in 7-10 business days.  I call 2 weeks later and speak with another rep only to find out that I missed an email (sent 2 days before call) requesting my banking info.  Provided my info and again was told I would receive my money in 5 business days.  Called back this morning only to be greeted by am automated message that they are closed for a conference and will only be responding via chat 2-5 and will return to “work” on Friday.  By mid day I received an email that says my request had been processed and my money would be received in 3 business days.  The problem with all the calls is when the reps tell you they have “processed” your request it hasn’t been.  Because after every call I would receive an email so many days later basically stating YOUR REQUEST HAS BEEN PROCESSED which it was not processed as all reps stated when I called.  So here it is now, June 29 and I have still not received my money from my closed account.
comments.company_response_content: I am so sorry to read of the issues you have had with our service recently.  I can see that your new card was due to be delivered around May 9th and you contacted us on May 17th to report it had not arrived.  When we looked into this, we discovered there was an issue and we worked very hard to resolved this for all members that were affected, however there were a few cases  that did take us longer than we had hoped to resolve and so you called us on June 10th to cancel your account.  I am really sorry that this issue meant we lost you as a member of ours, that is certainly not what we would wish for.  Once your account is cancelled, we sent a confirmation of our cancellation process, advising that the balance will be back in your account in 7-10 working days and so the latest you would expect to see your refund would be around June 24th.  We sent you an email on June 16th requesting your bank details, as due to the large amount being refunded, we were not able to send it back via your debit card details.  Unfortunately as you had not seen this email, this delayed the payment back to your bank even further.  Whilst you were able to give us the details needed on June 22nd, this initial delay together with our conference, unfortunately has meant that your refund will be received a week later than initially advised.  I am truly sorry for our part that was played with this delay, however I can advise that this was processed on the 29th and so should be with you either today or tomorrow.  Please accept my sincerest apology for any upset that this would have caused you and your family.  Leslie

comments.company_response_content: Hi, thank you for your review we are so glad the kids are enjoying the cards! With regards to the limits we do have 3 types, weekly, transactional and ATM to prevent them from over spending and this can be adjusted at any in our app. I have also submitted your feedback in regards to the daily limits to our team.We do have a feature allowing you to lock the savings so the children cannot access them without your permission. I have provided some quick and easy steps to action this in the app.  - Login to your parent account - Click the money icon at the bottom of the page and then savings - From there please click the goal and edit. - Scroll down and slide the bar to lock the goal to prevent your children from withdrawing the funds until you unlock it. I hope this helps, if you have any further queries please do contact us via email at help@gohenrycard.com or give us a call on 877 372 6466 we are open 9-5 EST. - Luwana.

comments.comment_content: This is a great system. The accounts are free. They have flexibility to deposit with card and accounts. They have gift links for special occasions. They also have the availability to have relatives to deposit in the accounts. They have customizable cards. You as a parent will have access to pins the amounts available.  The cards can be used at ATM online and in store. You can set limits to the cards. They also have auto saving and you can set the limit to however high. And about 10 yrs out. The have a chore list where kids can earn extra money. Only thing is I'd like a daily list. Right now they have weekly and one offs but not an automatic daily. Their customer service is awsome and no long hold times. They are also very understanding and patient with you. In all this is a 5 star service. My family and I love it

comments.comment_title: I am honestly confused and it may not…
comments.comment_content: I am honestly confused and it may not be your guys fault but , my card charged me 8 extra dollars when I got my nails done and I asked if there was extra fees or something like that and they confirmed and showed proof that that was not the case. I tried googling this situation but nothing really came up. If you get a chance please email me
comments.company_response_content: Hi Lorelei, thank you for your feedback. There are a few instances when you may see a pending transaction amount that is higher than the amount you spent.This is normally due to a hold put on purchases for tip oriented retailers or certain transactions. For the following types of transactions, you may see a pending transaction amount that is 20 percent higher than the total you spent, until the retailer settles your final bill, which usually happens by midnight on the day of purchase. The extra funds do get returned to the child’s account. We do this to avoid the child’s account going into a negative, as the child might decide to give a tip and if there are not enough funds in the account, it will make the account negative. The places this might occur are:Restaurants that accept tips/gratuity (note: pending transactions higher than the amount you spend will not occur at Fast food restaurants)Barbers and Beauty shops that accept tips/gratuityHealth and Beauty SpasLimousines & Taxi CabsHotels & MotelsIf you have any questions in regards to this, please do not hesitate to give us a quick call to (877) 372 6466 or at help@gohenrycard.com. - Nuria

comments.comment_title: Great for kids/pre-teens, not good for older teens.
comments.comment_content: My girls have had the GoHenry card for a while now and I have loved it….until my oldest started driving.  She tried to get gas at the pump today and it declined it because it is listed as an “adult store”.  Evidently, she can go inside to pay in the “adult store”, but not at the pump.  I understand it is a safety feature, but I wish I was allowed to approve certain locations such as this, because I would much rather her pay at the pump, than have to go inside where I feel she is even more likely to encounter people with bad intentions. I am now looking for a new debit card that gives teens a little more freedom.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Krista, thank you for your review and feedback! I'm sorry to hear that you are saddened by the child not being able to use the card at the pump. The reason why the cards may have trouble being used at the gas pump is due to the gas pump taking an amount that will hold until the payment has fully settled. If the child does not have the full amount, the transaction will decline. However, if the child goes to the gas station, they will be able to pay the exact amount. If you have any further questions, our Member Services team is available 7 days a week from 9am to 5pm EST time on (877) 372 6466 or at help@gohenrycard.com. - Nuria

comments.comment_title: Don't try closing your goHenry account...
comments.comment_content: We tried to close our account with goHenry. I do understand that it is frustrating and I am so so sorry that this has happened. I have tried to locate your account to discuss this further with you, unfortunately, I can not find any information from your review to locate your account.I would love to help you further regarding this and chase it up personally for you, so if you could please give us a call on 877 372 6466. comments.comment_title: Everything works with Gohenry until you…
comments.comment_content: Everything works with Gohenry until you have a problem.  I am West Coast US & it is totally impossible to get hold of anyone at GoHenry. Apart from the fact that the card works and there seem to be lots of customers, the whole thing appears very scammy.  Please contact me.  I need to talk to GoHenry

I have checked and I cannot see anything other than help@gohenrycard.com which is correct and the email that you used yesterday and prior to this we haven't received any emails from you. comments.comment_title: Issues transferring funds to my kid's card
comments.comment_content: First the positives, I actually fell in love with gohenry. Easy to use, my son was excited to do his chores and learn about money doing the money missions. After a week of using gohenry, I suddenly wasn't able to transfer money to my son's account. It said insufficient funds, but my funds were fine. Contacted customer service 3 diff times, no one could tell me anything, or how long to fix the problem, only that its being worked on and they would reach back out. After 2 weeks of the issue I decided to put more funds on the account because my son's auto weekly allowance still worked and the funds were down to about $4.00. When I added more money it seemed to fix the glitch, I was able to transfer money to his card again myself. I was happy. For a week it worked. But now again, once my funds gets down to around $20, its doing the insufficient funds again and I cannot transfer any money to my son.  Mind you I still haven't been contacted by them at all from reporting the issue almost 3 weeks ago. So I am canceling on Monday and will try out Greenlight. Really a shame because I loved gohenry.
comments.company_response_content: Thank you for your review, it was firstly nice to hear that you had been enjoying using GoHenry and the features that we have to offer. I am sorry to hear the issue you have been having when you try to transfer funds from the parent account to your childs account, it does not sound right that this is happening when you available funds. I would really like to have a look into this for you before you decide to cancel to see if there is anything we can do to bring a complete fix on the account. If you do give us a call, there should be a supervisor that can help and have a look into this for you. Again I am really sorry on the issues you have had when using GoHenry. -Elliot

comments.comment_title: Building the plane while flying it
comments.comment_content: I don’t mind the notion of building the plane while flying it, but producing more educational content on money management and investing consistently is needed.  My kids loved the courses and learned a lot.  Thank you for designing a tool to build financial literacy!Also, the tasks need to be more flexible.  I had to create a weekly spreadsheet with each of their tasks that need to be completed on a daily basis so they could check off what they completed and what they get for completing the chore each day.  Then at the end of the week they get paid for what was completed.  It would be great to set up a more flexible approach on tasks to design a weekly or monthly calendar with their chores and how much they get for completing each one on a daily basis.Lastly, the login feature online via the app vs accessing via a web browser does not synchronize quickly.  If I change the password via the web browser it is not recognized by the app and vice versa.  Nonetheless, I love the app.  It is very progressive, informative, and needed!  Great job!

comments.comment_title: Would not recommend GO HENRY at all!!
comments.comment_content: Would not recommend GO HENRY at all!!! One of the worst companies there is. Trying to get your money back from the go Henry is almost impossible and always 2-3 days!!! comments.company_response_content: Hello Steff,Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review, I'm sorry to hear that you did not experience our service the way we hoped you would.When loading your GoHenry account, GoHenry does not receive those funds until 2 to 3 working days, however, because we can see that those funds are on its way; we credit your account with those funds immediately as we do not like to make you or other GoHenry users wait, as we understand that the money loaded on your account is needed by your children and sometimes, they need it as quickly as possible. When you request money back from your GoHenry account to your bank card; as soon as we process this, it is sent straight away, but it is then dependent upon when your bank to credit your checking account and this typically takes 2 to 3 working days for them to process the credit.I do apologize for the wait times on our phone lines as people usually prefer to contact us this way. We are always trying to improve this process and our customer support is ever expanding and doing their best as much as they can. Alternatively, we are available to support you in other ways. You can also contact us via LiveChat on our website and you can always reach us on our email at help@gohenrycard.comI would love to help improve your experience with us and hear any feedback that you may have, so please do contact us. Our phone lines (877 372 6466) and LiveChat are open 09:00 until 17:00 EST but our inbox is open 24 hours, 7 days a week. - Faith

Our custom cards cost an additional $4.99-Parental controls: Parents can set spending limits and choose whether the card can be used online, in-store, or at an ATM-Automatic safety restrictions: Your kid won’t be able to purchase goods or services intended for adult use (18+)-Notifications: Both parents and kids can receive real-time notifications of any spending, available balances and reasons for declined transactions-Online & mobile access: GoHenry provides online and mobile banking, while many traditional bank accounts still don’t offer this service to anyone under 16-Tasks & chores: Teach your kids about earning and the value of money when you set up paid tasks in your GoHenry app-Savings Goals: Kids can set savings goals for automatic weekly saving in their GoHenry app-Giftlinks: Family and friends can use our Giftlinks feature to send gifts straight to your kids account, along with a personalized digital greeting-Add a co-parent: It’s free to add an additional parent or carer to help manage your kids GoHenry account-Giving: Teach your kid about charitable giving by setting up a regular donation of as little as 5 cents per week to our charity partner, Boys & Girls Clubs of America

For the following types of transactions, you may see a pending transaction amount that is 20% percent higher than the total you have spent, until the retailer settles your final bill, which usually happens within 48 hours from the day of purchase.The places this might occur are:Restaurants that accept tips/gratuity (note: pending transactions higher than the amount you spend will not occur at fast food restaurants)Delivery ServicesBarbers and Beauty shops that accept tips/gratuityHealth and Beauty SpasLimousines & Taxi CabsHotels & Motels*Please note, hotels & motels often hold money longer than 24 hours, and it may take up to 30 days for them to release their hold on your funds*After this time-frame, once the retailer claims the funds and they do not charge the 20% service rate, the funds will be released back into your child's account. This is to protect the child account from going into a negative balance at any time.If there's anything we can help with or you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 877 372 6466 - Ryan :)

comments.company_response_content: Hi there, thank you so much for your detailed review and I am pleased to read how you are liking it.  We have three ways for your child to receive their weekly allowance.  1 - set up the allowance to automatically pay each week, you can either tick auto top up so that our system debits your bank when we need to pay your child, or if you dont tick this, you would need to ensure that you have the funds in your account 24 hours before we are due to pay your child.  You can also set up tasks, so that one you tick them, they will pay on pocket money day.  Or you can just pay your child manually as and when you need.  Alternatively you can have a combination of all of these too if you wish.  To set up either tasks or allowance, just click onto your childs name, then cards then earnings. Our cards can be used in many countries, but please either check the website or call in to find a detailed list of the few countries that the cards cannot be used in.  I hope this helps.  Leslie

comments.comment_content: I love gohenry plain & simple. gohenry has proven to be the best preteen/ beginners debit card simply by teaching my 15 yr old son the value of earning money by completing task or chores at home. Before gohenry we, like most families had a chore chart & allowances you could earn for completing each task. Although it worked good for the 1st month. After that no one seemed interested in even looking at the chore chart or even cared about receiving allowance. Until now. Thanks to gohenry. It’s really helped keep him interested & excited about helping out & earning allowance in the process. As well as teaching him how to manage his earnings & the best way to save or spend them. He says that “having his own debit card with money on it that he actually worked for is so cool & way more fun than our dumb chore chart”. gohenry has made it so simple for parents to add or transfer money to or from their child’s debit card. As well as monitor what he’s spending his money on. I recommend gohenry to anyone who would like to teach their children how to use, manage or save money using a real debit card.

comments.company_response_content: Hi Stacey, Thank you for your review, We do understand the monthly fees isn't for eveyone. The monthly fees do cover alot of features to teach your children being smart with money which are listed below. - The GoHenry app for both you and your child/ren, available for both Android and IOS. - A free, contactless prepaid debit card. Our custom cards cost an additional $4.99.- Parental controls: Parents can set spending limits and choose whether the card can be used online, on the high street, or at an ATM- Automatic safety restrictions: Your child won’t be able to purchase goods or services intended for adult use (18+)- Notifications: Both parents and children can receive real-time notifications of any spending, available balances and reasons for declined transactions- Online & mobile access: GoHenry provides online and mobile banking, while many High Street bank accounts still don’t offer this service to anyone under 16.- Tasks & chores: Teach your child about earning and the value of money when you set up paid tasks in your GoHenry app.- Savings Goals: Children can set savings goals for automatic weekly saving in their GoHenry app.- Giftlinks: Family and friends can use our Giftlinks feature to send gifts straight to your child’s account, along with a personalised digital greeting.- Add a co-parent: It’s free to add an additional parent or carer to help manage your child’s GoHenry account.Giving: Teach your child about charitable giving by setting up a regular donation of as little as 5p per week to our charity partner, the BGCANow we’ve explained just what we are offering for that $3.99 charge, we hope you agree that GoHenry is a great choice for your family, and you’ll join us on our mission to make every kid smart with money.If you have any other questions, please contact us via our chat service, or call us on (877)3726466 We're open 9-5 EST 7 days a week. - George

It seems they can’t even get that right or take responsibility for their actions.Again, we do not recommend gohenry.
comments.company_response_content: Hi there.  I am really sorry that you feel you have had a negative experience with GoHenry.  We are very much an inclusive company and do cater to different needs for our children, indeed our app has a lot of tools that Parents can switch on or off, depending upon how they wish their child to use our service.  I understand that your concerns are around the pin number and your son not entering this correctly and then being locked out of his account.  If the pin has been forgotten, then the correct pin can be advised from both the child and parent app.  However I am sure you understand that we do need to ensure that our members money is safe, so if the wrong pin number is entered 3 times, then the card is locked and you would need to call us, so that we can ensure the card is in the right hands and then we can easily unblock it for you over the phone.  I hope that this information is helpful, but if not and you wish to go through anything else, then please do call in and ask to speak to me, I will be very happy to help.  Leslie

comments.comment_title: We decided to close our gohenry account…
comments.comment_content: We decided to close our gohenry account due to the lack of options to input chores. There was not a calendar but rather we had to input each chore with a day of the week label on that chore. There were not options to decrease the amount of money that we give each task. At least not a reasonable option. Closing the account was easy. We just had to call. Although days later we received an email stating we had to give our bank information to receive the balance. Feeling uneasy putting that information in an email, we had to call back. When we called back even days later because of our busy schedule. We asked why did they not request that information when we closed the account. They had some lame answer that they only close the account and cannot see that information but they can pass on the information to the correct department to process our refund. What? So after giving them our bank information they said it would take 7-10 days to process. Here we are still with no refund. We called again today since our children are getting anxious about not having their hard earned money. They apologized and stated it should take 2-3 more days. So early next week? The saga continues. Stay clear of gohenry. Their customer service team are pleasant enough especially with their accents but it doesn’t matter when all we want is our money back.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Lisa, I am really sorry you left us. I can understand your frustrations. Hopefully I can help clarify some things for you?  In relation to our tasks feature, you can create your own tasks "other" and set the amount to a minimum of $0.50 upwards. However if you wanted to give your child less than this, you could set a weekly allowance as low as $0.01. Our cancellation process is 7-10 days. The reason for this is to allow any pending purchases to fully clear before remining funds are processed back to the account holders nominated bank account. Sometimes our payments team do need a bank account to transfer the funds to when this happens they get in touch to ask for this. when we have this we process it as soon as possible and then the turn around time is two days, this is usually the minimum amount of time it takes your bank to receive the files and process them. I have popped you and email in relation to your refund specifically. -Elaine
Hello Ntozoka, Thank you so much for your positive feedback I am glad to hear the good experience you and your son are having. I hope you have a great day and Stay safe! - Ryan :)

comments.comment_title: Three things I hate and one thing I love
comments.comment_content: I hate how I have to have money in The “parent balance” to pay out my kid. Why cant it come out of my bank account? It’s an extra step and it takes 1-2 days to show up as a charge in my bank account. Also when making the chores list it’s annoying to have to mark chores weekly when my kid does them daily. I have to list the same chore 7 times. That is frustrating when there is 15 chores to list 7 times. I have 105 chores to check off by the end of the week. I’m also annoyed I have to pay a fee just to use it. The only thing keeping me using this is that my kid is enjoying it. Otherwise I’d go to a bank and open her a bank account and do this old school.
comments.company_response_content: Hello Michel, with our accounts the funds go into the parent account which is like a holding pot for the funds between the child's card and your debit card. This is here so you can add as much money as you want and keep it there waiting for your child. The transfer into the parent account is instant but your bank may take a few days to process the transaction but it should show immediately on your statement.We understand your frustration with the chores and are working on daily task options :) -Mya

comments.comment_title: I thought The fee was per family… it’s…

comments.company_response_content: Hello, The charges passed on to parents for gohenry membership is to simply keep the service running. We believe the unique features of our website, apps and card provides families with flexibility and convenience to manage money together and to help their children learn valuable money skills that will help them through life. For us, this makes the $3.99 monthly subscription charge great value for money.Here are some of the reasons we believe gohenry offers great value for money: Parental controls: our service offers children independence whilst the underlying control still sits with the parent to allow them to guide by setting spending limits and selecting where the card can be used.Mobile notifications: both parents and children can receive real time notifications of any spending, available balances and reasons for declined transactions - keeping you both informed every step of the way.Online and mobile access: gohenry provides online and mobile banking, while most High Street bank accounts do not offer this service to anyone under 16.Contactless card: our card enables your children to enjoy contactless payments. Tasks and chores: ability to set up tasks and chores for your children to earn extra money.Savings goals: because it's not all about spending, goals to save for that special something can be set up to help motivate whilst educate!Giftlinks: friends and family can gift money to the child for special occasions like birthdays and Christmas, or send a one off gift for anything else - send via a customised e card direct to the child with a choice of design and personalised message, child can then send a thank you backSupport 7 days a week: We are open 9am-5pm EST, 7 days a week and ready to help.gohenry incurs charges for each and every transaction we process via our third party partners and, whilst we try our best to absorb as much of these as we can, inevitably some of this is passed on to our members.We hope this gives you a better insight into the membership subscription charge.  If there are any of the features mentioned that you are unsure of or need a helping hand with something then please be assured we are here to help.  Our Member Services team are available 7 days a week from 9am-5pm EST, on 877 372 6466 or at help@gohenrycard.com-Mya

comments.comment_content: Overall, we like the app and my 13y daughter has been more motivated on chores and extra jobs now that she can flash a debit card in front of her friends.  The reason for 3 stars is the frustration level of setting up repeating chores.  The current options for types of chores are weekly and one-time.  I wanted to make mornings better (every morning) so I had to create a one time chore: Monday, get up 1st try, make bed, brush teeth.   Tuesday, get up 1st try, etc.  7 TIMES.  She has other daily goals/tasks that she may or may not complete so I had to do EACH of those 7 TIMES.  If you could make a chore that repeats daily I would give you 5+ stars.  That being said, I have recommended to friends with the above caveat.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Jeramy, thank you for your 3* star review. We are happy to hear that you are enjoying our service. We do have some exciting new features coming soon, one of them is the option for daily chores, something a lot of our members have been asking for. We are also very close to launching co parents for our members too, so thank you so much for taking the time to let us know what improvements you would like to see, as without our members vital input, we would not know what is really important to you. Please keep any eye out for both of these features as they are coming very soon and do let us know if you have any other ideas you would like to see. -Pedro

comments.comment_content: They charge you a monthly fee for teaching youth how to be responsible and still earn money. I can open a bank account at a bank free of charge no monthly fee. I think they are robbing kids
comments.company_response_content: Heya Lawanda.We are always disappointed to hear that a member has left us but do appreciate the service is not for everyone and, for some, the membership subscription does not work for their family.At gohenry we pride ourselves on offering so much more than a traditional high street bank account. As we are not a bank, we do not have the opportunity to absorb all the costs we incur as we don’t have the other avenues of money creation that banks rely on such as loans and mortgages.The charges passed on to parents for gohenry membership is to simply keep the service running. We believe the unique features of our website, apps and card provides families with flexibility and convenience to manage money together and to help their children learn valuable money skills that will help them through life. Features such as our parental controls, transaction notifications, contactless payments enabled are a few of the things our members find invaluable in supporting their children’s digital money management education. For us, this makes the $3.99 monthly subscription charge great value for money.We hope this gives you a better insight into the membership subscription charge. We would like to take this opportunity to thank you for your membership.-Mya

comments.company_response_content: Hi Charise,Thank you for your review and we're sorry to hear that you're unhappy with our service.Transactions on the gohenry card are free. The only transactions which will incur an additional charge are ATM withdrawals, which are charged an additional $1.50 plus the fee of the ATM provider and transactions to establishments that customarily charge a tip. When the card is used in establishments where tipping is the norm, such as restaurants, hair salons, nail bars, etc, 20% will be added to the amount of your child's transaction, when the funds are preauthorised and this is to prevent the card from going overdrawn if the retailer were to claim a tip. If they do not, the additional 20% will be released back onto your child's card when the transaction 'settles' which is usually within two to three days.Having looked into your account, I can see that your child has made one online transaction on their card and this did not incur any additional charges. I can however see that the monthly fee for your child's account for March was debited from your linked checking account on the same day, so this may be the cause of the confusion. I have sent you an email with some further information. Please do get in touch if you would like to discuss this further, or, if there is anything else we can assist you with. - Iliana :)

comments.company_response_content: It is disappointing to hear that you were not fully satisfied with the service we provided as this is something we truly take pride in. We review all feedback received to ensure we learn from the times when we don’t quite get it right and can take any corrective action to ensure we make the changes needed. It seems when my colleague asked for your date of birth, the information given was incorrect, which was why we were unable to verify you as the account holder in order to discuss your account or make any changes to it when you called.  Whenever you contact us, we do need to verify your details so that we ensure we are speaking with the account holder and not anyone else in order to discuss the account. This will be why we would ask for your full name, your date of birth (as the account holder), your zip code, and an additional security question selected. This is the information that you have provided when signing up for the account.  I can see that the card was not activated before your account was cancelled and without activation and the initial loading of the account,  then the Childs card will of course not work.If you still wish to have a GH account, then please do sign up again, ensuring you enter your personal details in correctly, then once you have made your first load and activated the childs card, you will be able to fully utilize our service.  I hope this was helpful, but if you do need to discuss this in more detail, then please do give us a call and we will be more than happy to do so.  Leslie

When friends and family want to send our daughter money, I simply send the gift link. Even better, some of the money goes into her savings account. I cannot say enough about how awesome this app is. OK, last comment (I promise). Regardless of the weekly amount ($5, $10, $20, etc) you can use this card. It does not require the parent to be a millionaire. Get this app for your children/child; thank me later.

comments.comment_title: The card is good and all BUT
comments.comment_content: The card is good and all. But there is someone from networks or ATMs from New York City trying to get in my son's account and withdraw money. I live in Texas my son is only 16. I don't know how people getting in their account. Without their card. This happened to my sons twice. They haven't take anything out yet but just thinking about it can happen got me kind of nervous. My son is in his room right now asleep and someone is in his account trying to take money out at an ATM machine in New York City how's this possible when he has his card and his wallet. I get alerts all the time when money's been deposits and when money's been distribute to all my kids account. This is scary I had to lock his car tonight so nobody could go into his account. Parents be aware the card is not protected seems like it's not safe like a credit card. Safe from scams scammers out there. My kids go online and buy things from Amazon and Roblox. This is just super weird.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Lori - thank you for reviewing. Sorry to hear that this has been happening to your son. We fully understand that it can be concerning when activity happens without your knowledge. As gohenry is a prepaid debit card, the protection differs to what is offered on credit cards. We would like to investigate this issue for you, as we are unable to locate any details from the info provided to Trustpilot, could you either send us an email to help@gohenrycard.com or give us a call on (877) 372-6466 between 9am-5pm EST ~Chelsey

comments.company_response_content: I am so sorry to read of your recent experience.  Thank you for taking my call just now, so that I could discuss this account in more detail with you. The information used to verify the details at account sign up centres around the account holders, rather than the child, so there is very little information that we hold on our accounts around the child's information.    I also apologise that your call to us earlier this month did not resolve this issue.  As discussed just now, I have taken steps to ensure that this account is closed and I will follow up with an email once this has been completed.  Leslie

comments.comment_content: GoHenry is easy to use, works exactly like my debit card. We have not had any issues purchasing at stores or online. Having the option to customize the card was a lot of fun. I've needed to reach out to customer service multiple times through the phone and through chat and the reps I spoke to each time were very helpful, polite, and informed. I would've liked to pick the PIN. It took my child a bit of time to remember it but over all it wasn't too big of a deal. I would love a daily task option, where the app would show only the tasks for that day, and whether they are checked off or not, the next day would have the same tasks again. This would come in useful for tasks like brushing teeth, and getting ready for bed, etc. We can't wait to see what new features GoHenry provides!

comments.comment_content: I decide to try this for our 11 year old with intellectual disabilities.   She is unable to count or add but can read numbers so I thought having an app where she could read the total amount and compare to the price of what she wants to buy would be a solution. I also love how I can transfer back to me if I need to give her cash instead.  She doesn't quite understand the giving yet but we set up to donate to the boys and girls club weekly so she can see it happens anyways and may eventually understand.  Adding chores is easy and she often does a chore that I add on.  Overall great app that helps her learn life skills and helps me be more organized about teaching them))

comments.comment_content: I am definitely liking GoHenry as is my son. A couple of things that I find a little less than optimal, which just may be for my own misunderstanding is:1) Certain gas stations (like ARCO) don't seem to take the GoHenry card. and 2) As my son is only with me half time I don't see an easy way to turn off his allowance on the weeks he is not with me. There may be a work around for this, but it wasn't obvious or easy to implement at a quick glance.Other than that I like how I can keep track of his spending.Great offering overall.
comments.company_response_content: Hello Merrill. Thank you for your 4* review! As gohenry cards are pre paid pocket money cards for under 18's, any merchants with an over 18 business code are blocked. Unfortunately, this may include some gas stations that sell over 18 products. We're sorry that there is not a way to select certain weeks of the month for the allowance to be paid. To turn the allowance off manually please  login to your parent account on the website or app and go to 'Earning'. Click the pencil icon next to 'Weekly allowance' and update the amount to $0. For the cancellation to be effective for the same week, remember to update the allowance amount before 6pm the day before your weekly allowance payment day. If there is anything else we can help you with, please get in touch. Thanks - El.
