comments.company_response_content: Hi Jeremy, I am so sorry to read this.  I have tried to call you to discuss, but had to leave you a message on your voicemail instead.I can see that you signed up to your account on the 14th January and your card was due to be delivered on the 25th January.  I can confirm that this has been despatched, however due to Covid, USPS are experiencing some delays with their postal service, so we do advise our members to wait a few days after the delivery date, just to ensure it does arrive, as ordering a new card too soon, can cause you further delays and we try very hard not to disappoint our members.  At this point however Jeremy, it is very overdue and so a replacement card does indeed need to be sent out to you.  I have sent you an email with some more information, so if you would be kind enough to reply back to me as soon as possible, I can then organise a new card to be despatched to you without any further delay.    LeslieUpdate 19/02 - Hi Jeremy, I have been keeping track of your card that I re issued for you and I am so pleased to see that it has arrived today and has now been activated.  If you need any information on how the account works, then please don't hesitate to call us.  Leslie

comments.comment_content: I cancelled my card today! Ativated it on Friday. They took out more money than I authorized from my checking. Which over drafted my personal checking account and I have no over draft protection! They said they did a refund the my checking and it’s Monday and I call and they just requested the return this morning even though the emailed me Friday the refunded it. Then I have zero money. My banks over drafter and I try it atleast use my go Henry card and my corner store that also happy be to a corner party store and I couldn’t use to card. It was declined cause I wasn’t 18?  I set the parental control and where he can spend and how much. This was a huge scam and has now cost me a small fortune out of my own pocket. I do not Recommend!
comments.company_response_content: i am sorry to read that your short experience with us was not a good one Shannon.  I understand from your call on Friday, that you had auto top up switched on and the agent you talked to explained how this worked, switched it off and requested a refund of the extra money in your GH parent account.  I can see that she also followed this up with an email to confirm that this refund can take 2 working days to show in your parent account.  As your refund request was late on Friday evening here, the "working" day began on Monday, which is when there refund was processed by our payments team and so you should receive the credit to your account today, being the 2nd working day.  All retailers have merchant codes set up on their payment machines and so as the GH card has a teen chip, transactions will not be allowed to be processed if the merchant has classed themselves as an over 18's retailer, so both yourself and GH cannot override this decision in this instance.  Whilst I am sorry that this has caused you some concern, I do hope that the information our agent provided you with both on the telephone call and the follow up email was helpful in understand what happened and what she was able to do to help you.  Leslie

comments.company_response_content: Hey Kim, we are sorry to hear this. In regards to the address, this will be the address you entered when signing up for the account and we verified you with. Our online verification matches the address you provided against Experian and Equifax databases which use the data from your state ID and drivers license. Therefore to have an account with us you would have signed up using the address on your state ID and drivers licence. As we have verified you to that address we will not be able to change the address until we have verified that you live there. We do this by asking you to activate the child's card and add funds using a debit card registered to that address. If you do not live at the address matching your state ID and drivers licence we will ask you to update your documents and sign up again. I can see you were able to add funds to your account but not yet activated the card. I have sent you an email to address this further. -Mya

comments.comment_title: There is a service fee but the app…
comments.comment_content: There is a service fee but the app doesn't do anything.
comments.company_response_content: The service costs $3.99 per child per month, this is for the use of the card, plus parent and child app.  In the Child app, they can see their money, what has been spent and where,  when tasks and pocket money due and can set up savings goals.  In the parent account, they are able to set up auto allowance, set tasks and tick to pay if they have been completed.  3 types of spending limits can be set by the parent and both child and parent receive real time notifications when the card is used.  This is not a standard debit card, but one that allows the parent to be in control of what they allow their child to spend and where they can spend it, which helps to teach good money sense in a safe environment. comments.comment_title: Love this card and the app for my son
comments.comment_content: Love this card and the app for my son. I wanted something for my 8 year old son to learn responsibilities and learn that he has to work for what he wants. I found this app and gave it a try. I was able to customize the card (would be nice to have more options) but we both have the app, where I can monitor his activities and he can keep tab of his spendings. “I feel like an adult” he said lol He has set up his goal to save every week. It teaches him to be responsible and complete tasks that i add as bonus to his allowance. The app is easy to use for both of us. Customer service was amazing in helping me get set up and going. PS: I referred my sister last week to start one for my godson and I received my $10.00 for the referral and so did she 😊 which made me very happy because although most companies say they will give you the credit, I usually have to call in and hunt them down. But this was automatically added to my parent funds. I had forgotten to add funds to be paid to my son because I am not enrolled in auto pay as yet by choice, so that $10 was helpful. So far, so good I’ve been using gohenry for about 3 weeks now and I have no complaints.
comments.company_response_content: Reading your comment was a delight, Whitney! It sounds like you are using gohenry to the fullest 👍 I hope we continue to deliver for you and your son. In regards to the refer-a-friend promotion, you can refer as many people as you would like. If you have any other family or friends who are interested, please make sure they sign up using the link you can send them 😉 We are hoping to introduce even more card designs in the future so please do keep an eye out 👀 - Evangeline

comments.company_response_content: Hi Chamik, thank you for your review. The charges passed on to parents for gohenry membership is to simply keep the service running. We believe the unique features of our website, app and card provides families with flexibility and convenience to manage money together and to help their children learn valuable money skills that will help them through life. Through us, parents can closely monitor spending through real-time notifications each time the card is used and can limit how much the child can spend per transaction, per week and per ATM withdrawal whilst children get the freedom of a bank card and access to their own online account to save money and monitor their spending. For us, this makes the $3.99 monthly subscription charge great value for money. If you have any questions or issues do not hesitate to contact us. Our Member Services team are available 7 days a week from 9am to 5pm EST time on (877) 372 6466 or at help@gohenrycard.com. :) -Nuria

We believe the unique features of our website, app and card provides families with flexibility and convenience to manage money together and to help their children learn valuable money skills that will help them through life. Through us, parents can closely monitor spending through real-time notifications each time the card is used and can limit how much the child can spend per transaction, per week and per ATM withdrawal whilst children get the freedom of a bank card and access to their own online account to save money and monitor their spending. For us, this makes the $3.99 monthly subscription charge great value for money. If you have any questions or issues, do not hesitate to contact us. Our Member Services team are available 7 days a week from 9am to 5pm EST time on (877) 372 6466 or at help@gohenrycard.com. -Nuria :)

comments.comment_content: gohenry has been a great way for my kid to be motivated to do his chores. It even helped us think of more chores he can do! It would also be really helpful if we could add a parent, too. Other than that, we really like the app's UI and design. With what we've experienced so far, we look forward to a lasting relationship with gohenry :)
comments.company_response_content: Hey Trina, thank you for leaving such an amazing review. It is great to hear your child is motivated to do chores and is gaining some financial independence.   I can see that you already have notifications set up, so that every time there is a spend, you will know about it - Please ensure that it is only yourself logging into parent account from your mobile phone.  then the notifications will be sent to  your phone, so to test this, log into your account via your app, then once your child uses his card, you should see the notification on your mobile - if this does not happen, then please do give us a call so that we can take a look at this for you.  With regards to topping up your account, each time you add money to your parent account, you will receive an email to acknowledge this load and it will be sent to the email address registered to your GH account.We appreciate your feedback about adding another parent, this is something we are already developing!-Mya

comments.comment_title: I feel like if you are giving a child a…
comments.comment_content: I feel like if you are giving a child a chance to learn, first off why would you charge them a fee for the card. You can apply at a bank and get a card for free.
comments.company_response_content: Hi there, I can understand the comparison that we get with banks. We are a pocket money service rather than a bank, so where banks earn their income from interest rates, our only income is from our membership fees. This allows us to maintain the accounts. The gohenry card gives parents the opportunity to load money into the child's account, set spending limits and weekly tasks to encourage them to do their chores i.e."earn their money" as well as teaching them to save for something specific to them. This is all relevant to what we all currently do in our adult life. So we think it's a valuable lesson to teach our children to manage their finances from a young age towards the digital future. We do understand that this isn't for everyone and regardless we are glad to hear when a parent has found something that works for them and their family.-Pedro

comments.company_response_content: Hi Jenna.Thank you for giving us your feedback, as it is only with our members input that we are able to improve our service. These features are something that we are currently developing, as we have been asked for this function by other members also.  In the meantime, I usually set up a Task  for each day of the week, simply called Monday through to Friday, then you can write the description next to what you need your child to do.  If you set this up as a weekly task, you can go in each week and change the description, if say you don't want them to tidy their room on the same day they did it last week.  You can do this by clicking on the pencil next to each task, from your parent account. I hope this helps-Beth

comments.comment_title: My grandson was deeply saddened the…
comments.comment_content: My grandson was deeply saddened the first time he went to use his card , at the local station in our town , that had a grill in it to buy a cheeseburger  his card was denied. Shortly after I had an alert message that said he could not use it at the store. Long story short it refered to the store as maybe selling products customers over the age of 18 may buy ... I'm curious if it was tobacco , or alcoholic beverages ??? Which is every store now , including the Dollar general , Walmart , and many gas stations .... Very disappointed
comments.company_response_content: Hello, I am deeply sorry to hear that your grandson felt let down by our service. As our cards carry the teen chip they will automatically decline in independent stores(that can serve alcohol and tobacco), corner stores,liquor, tobacco stores that have an over 18 merchant code. This code enables them to serve over 18 products. Any larger stores such as Walmart are authorised to serve alcohol but do not carry the over 18 merchant code, they are strictly regulated and must check ages of the customers buying in stores, So therefore the card will work in all stores like Walmart. I hope this helps, If you would like more support with your gohenry account please do get in touch Stay safe-Elaine :)

comments.company_response_content: Hello Joshua, I am sorry to hear that you have not been paid for jobs that you have completed. After reading your review I am little confused about what has been happening. I have attempted to locate your account and the only account I can find is an account that is not yet activated. If I can ask you to kindly email us or call us we will be able to take a look into this for you, in more detail.  help@gohenrycard.com (877)372-6466Our accounts are run by parent account holders for their children. It is the parent account holder who sets tasks/jobs for the child account holder to achieve. In order to qualify for the funds that are attached to each job or task they must be ticked off by the parent account holder or child depending on how this is set up.  If you are referring to someone else paying you for a job, this is not something we accommodate.  In order for funds to be placed onto a child account they must come from the parent account holders debit card. or via a gift link that is sent via the parent account holder to the person wishing to "gift funds" Please do get in touch with us so we can figure this out for you and offer you the best advice going forward. Kind regards, Elaine :)EDIT: That is absolutely no problem at all Joshua, happens to the best of us. As ever we are here for you should you need us. All the very best to you and your family- Elaine :)

comments.comment_title: I had a horrible customer service experience!!!
comments.comment_content: I had a horrible customer service experience today. I tried to create a new account and was told my identity was unable to be verified. Usually this is an easy fix and thought they may just need me to provide proof of verification. I started a live chat to determine how to verify my identification and provide any proof needed and was not even assisted I was just repeatedly told that I “failed the verification process and could not have any services with their company”. I assumed the live chat may have been a bot so I called the customer service phone number and spoke to a representative. It was not of anymore help. I was again told I “failed the identification process as my name and address do not match my social security number. I have provided them with all of my legal and accurate information and have not run into any issues with any other financial institution. I then asked the rep if there was a way I could provide proof of my identification and was told “unfortunately not and we cannot provide you with our services”. This was just an absurd experience and I have never had a company just deny their services without a clear explanation of anything I could do to continue the sign up process. I have not provided them with any false information everything was my legal and accurate information and I’ve had no issues elsewhere. I was also denied when I requested to speak with a supervisor. Beware before doing business with this company that this is what their customer service is like!!!!Edit: to add in reply to the reply from Gohenry. What I’m trying to explain to everyone involved is that ALL off my information is accurate and up to date on my ID. Everything matches! There is nothing different from the information given and my legal information/ID. Something was clearly done incorrectly on YOUR end as I’ve had no other issues with this at my current financial institution or any other place I’ve needed to present this information to. However you are not even allowing me to provide proof ofMy identification just saying “no We cannot provide you with services”. There’s NOTHING I can do on my end because as I said I am registered with my correct information, my ID has all of the correct information, the social security department has all of my correct information. There is nothing that should be conflicting. Something was done wrong on YOUR end!!! However you won’t even attempt to work with me to resolve this like any other company would such as allowing me to submit a copy of my ID, Proof of address or anything like that just giving me a blanket statement of “we will not provide you services because your information doesn’t match”. NO I absolutely will not attempt to sign up in the future because your customer service is horrible.Edit to reply: Yes I have read your email and you are telling me that I need to go get my drivers license updated. This is NOT helpful because it is UP TO DATE. It has my current legal name on it as well as my current address. You are also saying it is a temporary ID which is untrue. It is the current Drivers License required by and issued by the state of Ohio. Good luck running a business when you turn away eager and honest customers.
comments.company_response_content: Hello Down to Earth Mama, I am sorry to hear of your negative experience with our customer service, I understand your frustrations.  When you want to experience a service and see how it works but are not able to get over the first hurdle it can be really disappointing. Here at gohenry want to welcome everyone who wishes to use our service for what it is intended for. We believe every child should have access to an education in money management. Making it easier for people to access our services is something we feel very strongly about and we are constantly looking at ways to improve our customer journey and sign up process.  As a financial service, we must adhere to the US patriot act and as such,  we are obligated to "know our customer".As part of this we run background checks at the point of sign up, to verify your identity. Sadly if you do not pass this check or the information that you have provided does not match up to your state ID or drivers licence we simply cannot verify you and would not be able to offer you an account at this time. There are simple things you can do to enable you to sign up in the future, such as ensuring your State ID and drivers licence is up to date and reflects your current residential address, ensure you are on the electoral role and registered as such at your address.  I can confirm I have located your account and we are now currently in the process of looking into this in more detail for you and we will be in touch ASAP.  Again I do apologise for any distressed caused by our sign up process. All the best, Elaine :)EDIT - Hi there, I have looked into your application and have sent you a detailed email with the reasons you have not been able to pass our online Identification and the changes you need to make in order for us to be able to verify you.  I do hope that this helps to explain but if you need any more help, then please do let me know.  Leslie

comments.comment_title: Why do i have to load money to my…
comments.comment_content: Why do i have to load money to my. Gohenry account not directly to my kids card.. Stupid.. 1 star..the lamest thing i ever herd.. I dont trust this app sorry..
comments.company_response_content: In order to have a GH account, an adult over the age of 18 will need to apply to set this up.  With our service, the parent account holder has full control over how the account runs, so they would set up spending limits and allowance for instance to the child's card.  When loading the parent account, as the bank card is logged on the parent account, all money must be paid directly into the parent account first, as you have full control of each load.  You can of course set up an automatic allowance to be  paid to your child each week.  If you want a relative to pay your child, then you can send them a gift link - when paying in this way, any money sent will go directly into the childs card and not via the parent account.  I hope this information is helpful, but if you do need anything further, then please do let us know.  Leslie

My kids are 14 and 15 and routinely help each other get thru the week. My youngest has figured out his elder brother is not very spend conscious and is now racking in a little extra cash loaning his money for a brief period with interest to his older brother.  Their able to do this instantly thru the Gohenry app and I can see everything.  I had the idea of raising their allowance and making them pay for their phones each month.  The realization of how much they cost has really made their appreciation for their phones even more important to them.Get Gohenry you will not be disappointed. comments.comment_content: This is just a placeholder from this fraudulent financial company, trying to disguise itself as a US corporation, when in fact it is GoHenry.co.uk, a UK corporation.This is NOT a US-Based financial company, with no legal presence in the US other than some WeWork office, and questionable legal authority to operate a financial platform.
comments.company_response_content: Hi Ray,  I can best answer your review by giving you some history around gohenry.  We first started in the UK, 7 years ago and we were set up for parents by parents as there was nothing around at the time to help us teach our kids great money habits.  We have successfully grown in that time and decided to launch our service in America.  Our American service is fully regulated in the US, our bank is CFSB and all accounts are FDIC insured up to $250,000.  Our customer service is in the UK at present, as this is where the expertise on our service is at present, but we will at some point be moving this over the US as well.  I hope that helps to put your mind at rest that we are a legitimate US company, but if you have any other questions, then please do let me know.  Leslie
